content.question: What are the relative lengths of the carbon-to-oxygen bonds in this ion?

choices.label: Bonds <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> and <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math> are equal in length and longer than bond <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>.

Bonds <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> and <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math> are equal in length and shorter than bond <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>.

Bonds <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math> are equal in length and longer than bond <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>.
All three bonds are equal in length.

content.answer: Bonds <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> and <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math> are equal in length and shorter than bond <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>.

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
